remarks: In a graph with a finite number of vertices, the number of edges is finite if the number of edges not containing one of the vertices is finite.  Used for the step of the induction in ~ usgrafis . (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 5-Jan-2018.)
statement:
usgrafis.f $e |- F = ( E |` { x e. dom E | N e/ ( E ` x ) } ) $.
usgrafisinds $p |- ( Y e. NN0 -> ( ( V USGrph E /\ ( # ` V ) = Y /\ N e. V ) -> ( F e. Fin -> E e. Fin ) ) ) $.
$d E x $.
$d N x $.
